channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: European leaders pledge to back Ukraine. And, takeaways from the Oscars
item.description: Several global leaders pledged support for Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's efforts to stop Russia's war. And, heartfelt speeches, a big surprise and history were made at the Oscars.
item.content:encoded:
Several global leaders pledged support for Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's efforts to stop Russia's war. And, heartfelt speeches, a big surprise and history were made at the Oscars.

(Image credit: Peter Nicholls)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Seeing Washington change course on Ukraine, Taiwan ponders its own fate
item.description: Developments in the Ukraine-U.S. relationship have regularly made headline news in Taiwan lately. Many in Taiwan compare Ukraine's fate to its own, as China continues to threaten an invasion.
item.content:encoded:
Developments in the Ukraine-U.S. relationship have regularly made headline news in Taiwan lately. Many in Taiwan compare Ukraine's fate to its own, as China continues to threaten an invasion.

(Image credit: Ashish Valentine)
item.dc:creator: Ashish Valentine

item.title: What you need to know about Trump's address to joint session of Congress
item.description: President Trump will lay out his second term agenda in an address to a joint session of Congress on Tuesday night. From talk on tariffs to the U.S. role in the world, here's what to expect.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump will lay out his second term agenda in an address to a joint session of Congress on Tuesday night. From talk on tariffs to the U.S. role in the world, here's what to expect.

(Image credit: Mark Wilson)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: To solve for doctor shortages, states ease licensing for foreign-trained physicians
item.description: Some states are trying to make it easier for doctors trained in other countries to work in the U.S. Skeptics say other licensing and hiring barriers could hamper this effort.
item.content:encoded:
Some states are trying to make it easier for doctors trained in other countries to work in the U.S. Skeptics say other licensing and hiring barriers could hamper this effort.

(Image credit: Roya Qaemi)
item.dc:creator: Arielle Zionts

item.title: Private company's Blue Ghost spacecraft makes historic lunar landing
item.description: For the first time, a private company has successfully landed a probe on the moon. Firefly Aerospace's "Blue Ghost" lander touched down on the lunar surface early Sunday morning.
item.content:encoded: For the first time, a private company has successfully landed a probe on the moon. Firefly Aerospace's "Blue Ghost" lander touched down on the lunar surface early Sunday morning.
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Poll: Majorities say state of the union is not strong, and Trump is rushing change
item.description: How Americans are reacting to the first month of the administration, according to an NPR/PBS News/Marist poll.
item.content:encoded:
How Americans are reacting to the first month of the administration, according to an NPR/PBS News/Marist poll.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: Foreign students say the threat of Trump's executive orders is getting real
item.description: President Trump warned international students that if they support groups the U.S. deems terrorist organizations, "we will find you, and we will deport you." It's left many student activists anxious.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump warned international students that if they support groups the U.S. deems terrorist organizations, "we will find you, and we will deport you." It's left many student activists anxious.

(Image credit: John Tlumacki)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith

item.title: Trump wants Palestinians out of Gaza. Here are Egypt's plans to keep them there
item.description: Arab leaders will meet in Cairo to reject Palestinian displacement from Gaza. NPR looks at Egypt's reconstruction plans for Gaza that counter President Trump's ideas of expulsion.
item.content:encoded:
Arab leaders will meet in Cairo to reject Palestinian displacement from Gaza. NPR looks at Egypt's reconstruction plans for Gaza that counter President Trump's ideas of expulsion.

(Image credit: Anas Baba/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Crews battle wildfires in North and South Carolina amid dry conditions
item.description: The National Weather Service warned of increased fire danger in the region due to a combination of critically dry fuels and very low relative humidity.
item.content:encoded:
The National Weather Service warned of increased fire danger in the region due to a combination of critically dry fuels and very low relative humidity.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: At Oscars, 'No Other Land' co-directors call for national rights for Palestinians
item.description: The Oscar-winning documentary, made by a team of Palestinian-Israeli filmmakers, follows the displacement of rural Palestinian communities in the Israeli-occupied West Bank.
item.content:encoded:
The Oscar-winning documentary, made by a team of Palestinian-Israeli filmmakers, follows the displacement of rural Palestinian communities in the Israeli-occupied West Bank.

(Image credit: Kevin Winter)
item.dc:creator: Chloee Weiner
